1568049511_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body: Im a programming student and we always use the older version of the API. But I do understand that newer API is stable and modern and such. I'n android studio when you choose the android version to support you have a % that tells you how many devices would be hable to use that app. And then it's true that when you get ot things in the API that need a modern version of android you can simply do an IF statement such as old devices without that newer android version are cut of of certain parts of the app.
